alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Merrick; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 5:16PM CDT until May 12 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... York County in east central Nebraska... Hamilton County in south central Nebraska... Central Merrick County in central Nebraska... Polk County in east central Nebraska... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 515 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Marquette to near Hampton to near Grafton, moving northeast at 55 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR YORK, HAMILTON, AND POLK COUNTIES. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Bradshaw around 520 PM CDT. McCool Junction around 525 PM CDT. York, Polk and Benedict around 530 PM CDT. Waco around 535 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Stromsburg, Osceola, Shelby and Gresham. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 330 and 365. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
